attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It is claimed that speed humps are installed to enforce the statutory speed limit but invariably they force vehicles to reduce speed to under 10 mph or risk damage to the vehicle or loss of control. The local authority installing such speed humps are in fact obstructing the highway which is an offence under the Road Traffic Act. Speed humps should permit vehicles to pass over them at the legal speed limit or the Authority installing them should be laible for prosecution and the offending speed humps removed.

rejection.details: The petition should be a call to action for the Prime Minister, in particular the title, which should not be your name. However, there is already a petition about this issue that you can sign without creating another: http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/Nohumps/
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
